answer_html: Then \(Ax = b\) corresponds to the given problem.
answer_latex: Then $Ax = b$ corresponds to the given problem.
hints_html: Make x just the vector of the variables. The coefficients of the variables go in the matrix A. In the original equations, put the constants on the right hand side, then put them into the vector b.
hints_latex:
Make \emph{x} just the vector of the variables. The coefficients of the
variables go in the matrix \emph{A}. In the original equations, put the
constants on the right hand side, then put them into the vector
\emph{b}.
hints_raw: Make ''x'' just the vector of the variables. The coefficients of the variables go in the matrix ''A''. In the original equations, put the constants on the right hand side, then put them into the vector ''b''.
question: A 19
sols_html:
Rearranging the equations gives

\(x_{1} + 2x_{2} + 3x_{3} = -4 \qquad \text{and} \qquad -2x_{1} -3x_{2} -4x_{3} =5\)

So if we take

\(A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ -2 & -3 & -4 \end{bmatrix} \qquad x = \begin{bmatrix} x_{1} \\ x_{2} \\ x_{3}\end{bmatrix} \qquad b = \begin{bmatrix} -4 \\ 5\end{bmatrix}\)

Then \(Ax = b\) corresponds to the given problem.
sols_latex:
Rearranging the equations gives

$x_{1} + 2x_{2} + 3x_{3} = -4 \qquad \text{and} \qquad -2x_{1} -3x_{2} -4x_{3} =5$

So if we take

$A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ -2 & -3 & -4 \end{bmatrix} \qquad
x = \begin{bmatrix} x_{1} \\ x_{2} \\ x_{3}\end{bmatrix} \qquad 
b = \begin{bmatrix} -4 \\ 5\end{bmatrix}$

Then $Ax = b$ corresponds to the given problem.
sols_raw:
Rearranging the equations gives

<math> 
x_{1} + 2x_{2} + 3x_{3} = -4 \qquad \text{and} \qquad -2x_{1} -3x_{2} -4x_{3} =5
</math>

So if we take

<math>
A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ -2 & -3 & -4 \end{bmatrix} \qquad
x = \begin{bmatrix} x_{1} \\ x_{2} \\ x_{3}\end{bmatrix} \qquad 
b = \begin{bmatrix} -4 \\ 5\end{bmatrix}
</math>

Then <math> Ax = b </math> corresponds to the given problem.
statement_html:
The geometric problem of intersecting two planes \(P_{1}\) and \(P_{2}\) given respectively by the equations

\[\begin{aligned} x_{1} + 2x_{2} + 3x_{3} + 4 = 0 \qquad \text{and} \qquad -2x_{1} -3x_{2} -4x_{3} - 5=0\end{aligned}\]

can be written as a matrix equation \(Ax = b\). Give possible choices of A,x and b.
statement_latex:
The geometric problem of intersecting two planes $P_{1}$ and $P_{2}$
given respectively by the equations

\begin{align*}
x_{1} + 2x_{2} + 3x_{3} + 4 = 0 \qquad \text{and} \qquad -2x_{1} -3x_{2} -4x_{3} - 5=0
\end{align*}

can be written as a matrix equation $Ax = b$. Give possible choices of
\emph{A},\emph{x} and \emph{b}.
statement_raw:
The geometric problem of intersecting two planes <math> P_{1} </math> and <math> P_{2} </math> given respectively by the equations

:<math> 
x_{1} + 2x_{2} + 3x_{3} + 4 = 0 \qquad \text{and} \qquad -2x_{1} -3x_{2} -4x_{3} - 5=0
</math>

can be written as a matrix equation <math> Ax = b </math>. Give possible choices of ''A'',''x'' and ''b''.
